title: Cassiopeia  mains are finally geting a new skin! Eternum Cassiopeia here boys

embed.description: Eternum Cassiopeia(暂译：上古魔蛇）即将登陆召唤师峡谷。

replies.body:
Kinda disappointed how edgy it is, I would have loved some more fanservice for the snake. Ahri is getting sexy skins on an annual basis, meanwhile the snakelady has to wait over 4.5 years for a skin that probably won't even sell well to the weebs.

If this skin doesn't sell well, she won't be seeing another skin in a very long time. That'd be the worst possible outcome.

> [{quoted}](name=Snaketits,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l92cZdLE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-08-22T10:49:21.457+0000)
>
> Kinda disappointed how edgy it is, I would have loved some more fanservice for the snake. Ahri is getting sexy skins on an annual basis, meanwhile the snakelady has to wait over 4.5 years for a skin that probably won't even sell well to the weebs.
> 
> If this skin doesn't sell well, she won't be seeing another skin in a very long time. That'd be the worst possible outcome.

There are just some champions that get more love than others do . So sad to know that is the truth

Most Cassiopeia skins are fanservice anyway.  Jade fang, mythic, desperada, and arguably siren are all just "here's a skimpy half snake". Instead of focusing on the danger part of being a half snake.  Glad she got a serious skin.

> [{quoted}](name=Catalin10GG,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l92cZdLE,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-08-22T10:55:16.382+0000)
>
> There are just some champions that get more love than others do . So sad to know that is the truth

This might be a shocking bit of news:

League of Legends, the free to play game which offers the fundamental parts of gameplay (champions, runes, masteries) completely free of charge/ for free in game currency, uses the release of skins to make profits. Players of this for-profit game are more likely to buy skins for champions which they play. Champions that are played by more people are popular champions, and some champions are consistently more popular due to a variety of factors including design, reliability, fun, etc. In order to continue to make profits of increasing returns, Riot will often release skins which people are more likely to buy due to being for champions that are played more often by these people. I don't know if I'd call it love, but it certainly is the truth.
Lol, of course you get downvoted for saying the truth.

As expected from Cass mains.
Not even satisfied when they get a sick ass skin.

That's pathetic.

That's extremely shortsighted of you. Did you even understand my concerns with the skin?

The skin itself is a bit underwhelming considering the longass wait she had to endure (1350 RP skins are the new standard and by no means anything special), then there's the good possibility that it won't sell very well due to its nature which would possibly lead to 4 or 5 more years of no skin-releases for her.
I don't think 1350 skins are the new standard, just because Riot's released more of them this year.

Out of the 50 skins we got this year so far (also counting the new Star Guardian skins and Thunder Lord Ornn):
-2 are 750
-6 are 975
-2 are Hextech exclusive
-5 are 1820
-35 are 1350

35 out of 50 cost 1350 RP, not saying that this is a bad thing, but I'm curious as to what lead to this trend

I would say it is because they can sell well, personally, I like seeing a new recall and ability textures when I buy a skin. Also, 1350 skins have a price of (almost)exactly $10.

Just a theory, I think with the amount of champions in the game, the skins that they get need to look cool, first because some champions already have lots of cheap skins(Annie), and secondly because who knows when they will get another skin with 139 champions(incl. Ornn).
It wouldn't have sold well anyway because Cassiopeia doesn't have that large of a playerbase.

I don't think that's very fair. Sion doesn't have a very large playerbase either and he got a legendary skin. If you execute on a concept well enough, people will flock to the champion because the skin makes them that much more exciting.

You are saying sex sells, not enough sex, not enough sales. This however, is a respectable skin that offers a-I don't even think thematic goes deep enough-motif we haven't seen her in yet. She is imposing, inhuman, indifferent.

"Sick ass skin"?
This skin isn't even decent.

Look at the tail, it reminds me of those "ultralow graphics Skyrim" videos.

Eternum Nocturne is awesome. Eternum Rek'Sai is very good. This? This is just sad.
This skin is better than both of the other eternum skins, ungrateful cass mains always have to complain about something smh.

Sure, sure, let's eat everything they will shit out.
No criticism allowed.
You can criticize obviously. We are also allowed to qualify your criticism as pedantic whining however :)
If it wasn't for this "pedantic whining" Fiora would still look like a tumblrina, but sure. :^)
pfff, doubt it. Riot takes feedback from way larger sets of data than 3 threads on the forums complaining about Fiora

Clearly.

Except when those "3 threads on the forums" had the exact changes Rito did.

I also proposed Eternum Cassio about two years ago, really doubt my exact thread is what made it a reality. This is a numbers game, sure, a Rioter might have read the post and taken it into account in one specific occasion. But more often than not, baseless complaining leads to nothing but a few amount of people complaining.

Also good job on derailing my point, which was you are entitled to an opinion, which other people can qualify as dumb or whiny just as you think theirs is dumb.  Just as you think Cassio's is new skin is "shit you have to eat" many others think it is awesome, whether you like it or not (just look at the number of likes this post has vs the vocal minority complaining about it)

>I also proposed Eternum Cassio about two years ago

When Fiora was being VGU'd it took Rito 2-3 days to adjust her model based on the community feedback.
Like 3 times.

>Just as you think Cassio's is new skin is "shit you have to eat"(...)

When you quote something, do it properly.

>(...)many others think it is awesome, whether you like it or not (just look at the number of likes this post has vs the vocal minority complaining about it)

I'm sure the vocal majority not owning Cassiopeia will buy the skin.

80/20.

1.- That wasn't a vocal minority, that was well-founded criticism that was shared by a significant portion of the comunity. You can see it here:

https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/b9U0UgGu-problems-with-the-new-fiora-art

2.- Sorry my bad, lemme try again: Just as Sraeg2013 (Forums, 2017) eloquently comments: "Sure, sure, let's eat everything they will shit out.". 

Pfff, don't even understand why you bothered writing that crap as if anyone cares

3.- Math and Logic seems to be hard for you, so I'll help you out!  

There are around 5 people actually complaining about the skins look here, compared to the almost 50 likes the post likes, the vocal minority (being you and 4 other people) will not buy the skin compared to a larger proportion of players who apparently like it and will. Also your sentence makes very little sense as you can't correlate what you said from what I did in my previous post

> [{quoted}](name=DeadUnborn,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l92cZdLE,comment-id=00010002000100000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-22T21:28:40.388+0000)
>
> 1.- You can still deal with fractions of community that are upset about a change. For example a lot of people complained that omega squad twitch wasn't holding his knife by the handle. I'm not seeing near the same level of response to this skin. I'm lecturing because you brought it up and are failing to introduce that argument to this conversation correctly.

And you are doing the same exact thing.
Not holding a knife correctly aka animations not aligning properly could be considered a bug or an oversight.

We aren't talking about an oversight here, but a deliberate design choice.

> 2.- I think you are confusing the words sarcasm and irony, and using both wrong btw. again not that any of this matters in the least as you are just scratching for random stuff to "attack me" with

Oh? Then what is sarcasm and what is irony?

> 3.-This is just your opinion, as you don't know what they clicked "upvote" or commented for. you can only extrapolate that it is a positive sentiment and that it outweighs the negative quantity of posts this thread has. Also it has been proven numerous times that people are more likely to go out of their way to complain about something on the internet than leaving positive feedback. Still, the number of upvotes this thread has is still significantly higher than the number of people complaining about it, and no amount of statistical jargon you use will change that. 

Clearly the entire M&G is the essence of internet complaining.

> 4.- I invite you then to make a thread actively complaining about Casio's new skin. Link me to it and let's see how thing go. Lol

Maybe you've seen one of my comments in this thread, but if not I'll say that I haven't played Cassiopeia since her initial rework.

The only reason I'm "whining" about the skin here, is because if my main got a skin of this quality I'd be doing that too.
Except then I'd also care enough to make a separate, constructive thread about it.

>1.- That wasn't a vocal minority, that was well-founded criticism that was shared by a significant portion of the comunity. You can see it here:
>
>https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/b9U0UgGu-problems-with-the-new-fiora-art 

Skins never get as much traction as an entire champion.
Also why are you lecturing me about something I was a part of?

> 2.- Sorry my bad, lemme try again: Just as Sraeg2013 (Forums, 2017) eloquently comments: "Sure, sure, let's eat everything they will shit out.".
> 
> Pfff, don't even understand why you bothered writing that crap as if anyone cares

Oh, the sarcasm. Still, context is important.

>3.- Math and Logic seems to be hard for you, so I'll help you out! 
>
>There are around 5 people actually complaining about the skins look here, compared to the almost 50 likes the post likes, the vocal minority (being you and 4 other people) will not buy the skin compared to a larger proportion of players who apparently like it and will. Also your sentence makes very little sense as you can't correlate what you said from what I did in my previous post

Speaking of correlation those 50 likes have nothing to do with the quality of the skin, but with _"oh lawd Cassie is finally getting a skin!"_.
By extension people who share the same sentiment will be the majority in this thread, which is why _"the vocal minority of you and 4 other people"_ is, well, minority.
Because this thread isn't about the skin feedback.
Man, imagine Eternum Morde...
is this serious? i dont play cass but it's unexpected that they would release a new skin that is not part of the any other sets RIGHT after then arcade event....
What do you mean by sets? Rek'sai and Nocturne are apart of this.

> [{quoted}](name=BETA253,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l92cZdLE,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-08-22T10:47:15.505+0000)
>
> is this serious? i dont play cass but it's unexpected that they would release a new skin that is not part of the any other sets RIGHT after then arcade event....

Yes , it is official . You will see the skin on PBE tonight !
{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
Welp we Eve mains will have to wait another year feelsbadman
Well duh. She's in the middle of her VGU. She isn't eligelbe for a skin.
Along with the fact that every single one of her skins is being updated for the VGU, too.

If there's one thing that could be improved about this skin, it's definitely her ultimate. Remember the crazy sound Eternum Nocturne's R made whenever he used it? That stuff was *extremely* bonechilling. 

It'd be a shame to miss out on that for an ultimate that's supposedly as terrifying. Maybe make it twice as loud for her? Also an additional metal-soundeffect for the cast wouldn't hurt either.

I don't really like how it's breaking theme with the other Eternum skins, which are mostly metal plates and red lightning/energy. They have almost none, if any "soft parts", yet Cassio is just red Cassio with armor.

http://news.cdn.leagueoflegends.com/public/images/articles/2014/december_2014/ETNMRS/Eternum_RekSai_Screenshots_thumb.png
http://riot-web-static.s3.amazonaws.com/images/news/December_2012/2012_12_05_Eternum_Nocturne_Release/Nocturne_Eternum_Comic.jpg
Rek'Sai and Nocturne clearly have a lot of areas that are fleshy "soft parts." Their tails aren't, but the main body is red flesh with plates. 

https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-D2WImpMmH7Y/WZwemJnvhnI/AAAAAAAAsgo/NTBxx9KcPSwcp1GG5w1lPnXgLb7FPfEhQCLcBGAs/s1600/3.png

Cass follows this theme pretty much verbatim, with a few exceptions due to her model.

Not even remotely close.

With the exception of fingers Nocturne looks like a living armor.
Rek'Sai looks like if she was flayed and armor plates were grafted to her bones/muscles.

This Cassio skin looks like a cheap attempt at Eternum Nocturne.
The tail was recolored hot pink and she was given a metal "skirt".
Nocturne does not just look like living armor. He has red, jagged flesh beneath his armor, holding his torso armor together. His flesh is quite visible. Same goes for Reksai.
Thats what I was thinking. I feel like its just a recolor
How?

Maybe not her appearance persay, but all her spell effects just feel like recolors to me. When I buy a new skin thats more than 975, what I mainly look at is spell effects. That's what youre gonna be focusing on when playing, you aren't gonna be staring at your champ.

I have all skins for Cass and even have Mastery 7 on her. Seeing this skin, the model itself is GORGEOUS. However, the particles seem to be lacking as it's reminiscent to her regular particles but red. They should emphasize the electric particles more. I'll wait to see the skin spotlight but the initial response is mixed.

> [{quoted}](name=Forbidden Siren,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=l92cZdLE,comment-id=0010,timestamp=2017-08-22T13:37:35.837+0000)
>
> I have all skins for Cass and even have Mastery 7 on her. Seeing this skin, the model itself is GORGEOUS. However, the particles seem to be lacking as it's reminiscent to her regular particles but red. They should emphasize the electric particles more. I'll wait to see the skin spotlight but the initial response is mixed.

Well, the skin hasn't been released so maybe they can still do this.
More like Darkin Cassiopeia
They also stated they'll be releasing skins for {{champion:112}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:163}} {{champion:83}}
The leak was confirmed to be fake if that's what you're talking about
In the very teaser post for this skin they said those champions had skins on the way too. Look at the edit in the OP.
{{champion:83}}  We will prevail, we have eternity...
The skin looks kinda okay to me. Allthough I hope it's a legendary with a new voiceover because otherwise this feels kinda "meh" in terms of Model and Visuals.

It's a meh skin because they aren't even trying anymore. Fan made skins have better quality at this point. The poison looks like a recolored palette that's it, then the model looks like it was lumped together out of desperation. This seems like another meh skinline like the new star guardian ones.

tbh I'd be better off with Jade Fang Cass, because you only pay 975 for new effects and a neat model.
A new skin is cool and all, but the eternum Skins.... that's just not my cup of tea.
